description: Construction of 2 x part two-storey and part single storey dwellinghouses with basement accommodation with associated vehicle parking space and access gate (following demolition garages).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):

Location plan, Flood map, Sheffield bike stand, P.1 - Existing ground floor plan, P.2 - Existing elevations, P.3 - Proposed elevations, P.4 A - Axonometric 001, P.5 - CGI, P.6 - CGI, P.7 - CGI, P.8 - CGI, P.9 - CGI, P.10 - Proposed basement, P.11 A - Proposed ground floor plan, P.12 A - Proposed first floor plan, P.13 - Proposed roof plan, P.14 A - Proposed section, P.15 A - Proposed section, P.16 A - Proposed landscape plan, P.17 - Green roof treatment, P.19 - Access details, Brick details, Turntable details, Email received on 15/09/2020 concerning waste.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Prior to the commencement of the superstructure works, details/ samples of materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The samples details shall also include elevations and materials to be used for the  approved gate. This condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policy 3.4 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012); policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out as per the approved plans. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season. For the avoidance of doubt, this includes the green roofs.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (i) and 1.2 (d) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.

| Refuse and recycling storage areas as shown on the approved plans and as stated on the email received on 15/09/2020 shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter. The refuse management arrangements as received via email on 15/09/2020 shall also be implemented and remain in place for perpetuity.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2016) policy 5.16.

| A minimum of four (4) secured cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site as shown on hereby approved plans and in accordance with the adopted standards of the London Plan (2016).  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and increase the use of active and sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies 6.1, 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| The first-floor windows on the southern elevation on each dwelling, which provide light and outlook to the stairs of both properties (shown on drawing number P.12), shall at all times be glazed with obscure glass.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4, and 7.B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and National Planning Policy Framework (2018).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement or other alteration of the new dwellinghouses shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local planning authority.

Reason: The local planning authority considers that further development could cause detriment to the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area and for this reason would wish to control any future development to comply with section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2015.

| Prior to commencement, a desktop study which shall include the identification of previous site uses, potential contaminants that might reasonably be expected given those uses and other relevant information shall be submitted to and approved by the LPA.

The above study shall include a Conceptual Site Model (CSM) for the site identifying all potential contaminant sources, pathways and receptors shall be produced and assessment of risk to identified receptors undertaken.

B) Once a desktop study has been completed, a site investigation will need to be designed for the site using the information obtained from the desktop study and any diagrammatical representations (Conceptual Model).  This would also need to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to that investigation being carried out on the site.  The investigation must be comprehensive enough to enable:
- a risk assessment to be undertaken relating to future occupants of the site and to groundwater and surface waters associated on and off the site that may be affected, and
- refinement of the Conceptual Model, and
- the development of a Method Statement detailing the remediation requirements.

C) A site investigation shall then be carried out and this assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site. The findings of the site investigation and proposed remedial options shall then be submitted to the Local planning authority for approval in writing prior to any remedial works commencing and any development works commencing.

D) 	Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced, and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with the latest Environment Agency guidance and industry best practice.

Reason: To ensure the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy1.1 (j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2015 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.
| No part of the roof of the single storey projections shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4, and 7.B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and National Planning Policy Framework (2018).

| Prior to occupation of the dwellings, the parking space as shown on the approved plans shall be constructed and operational. The number of parking spaces within the site shall also not be increased above and beyond what is shown on the approved plans without first obtaining permission from the LPA.
Reason:  In the interest of public safety, in accordance with policies 6.3 of the London Plan (2016); and policy 1.1(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012).

| The rating noise level emitted from the gates and turntable hereby approved, as assessed under BS4142:2014, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA, as measured at 3.5m from the nearest sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during periods of operation.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| No planting or fencing (including walls or other means of enclosure) shall be provided exceeding a height of 0.6m high within the pedestrian visibility splays (measuring 1.5m x 1.5m).
Reason:  In the interest of public safety, in accordance with policies 6.3 of the London Plan (2016); and policy 1.1(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012).

| No construction shall take place until details of a construction method management plan have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The management plan shall include the following: delivery times (staggered to avoid afternoon and school run peak periods); dust suppression measures; erosion protection measures for excavations; site security during construction; construction vehicle and manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear; procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents. Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1(e)(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2016); the National Planning Policy Framework (2012); Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006); and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
